subject: linear_algebra
title: Vector Arithmetic
contentHtml: Vector arithmetic is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that allows us to perform operations on vectors.

workedExample.problemHtml: Find the result of adding two vectors: \[(2,3),(4,-1)\] and \[(-1,0),(1,2)\].

steps.explanation: We add the x-components and y-components separately

intuition: Vector arithmetic allows us to combine vectors in a way that preserves their geometric meaning.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Vector Arithmetic
contentHtml: Vector arithmetic is a fundamental operation in linear algebra that allows us to combine vectors using addition, subtraction, and scalar multiplication.
latex: \( \mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} a_1 + b_1 \\ a_2 + b_2 \\ \vdots \\ a_n + b_n \end{bmatrix},\)
name: Vector Addition" },
explanation: We combine the corresponding components of the two vectors" } ],
intuition: Vector arithmetic is useful when working with physical systems, such as forces and velocities, where we need to combine vectors to represent the overall behavior.
